author: Jonathan Cheng
title: U.S. Mission for South Korea’s Moon: Keep Trump-Kim Summit on Track
text:
SEOUL—South Korea’s leader arrives in Washington on Monday with a high-wire bid for peace on the Korean Peninsula—and his own status as peacemaker—in the balance.
The challenge for South Korean President Moon Jae-in, who is scheduled to meet with President Donald Trump on Tuesday, is to keep on track a historic planned meeting between Mr. Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un that looks increasingly at risk of being derailed.
... RELATED VIDEO Behind the Scenes of North Korean Diplomacy Top diplomats and government officials discuss risks, hopes and the future of North Korean relations at the WSJ CEO Council in Tokyo ahead of the planned Trump-Kim meeting in Singapore.
